What is the function of the NVIC in the.question: What is the function of the NVIC in the STM32F4 microcontroller?
What is the function of the NVIC in the.model_answer:
A: The NVIC (Non-Volatile Interrupt Controller) is a hardware component of the STM32F4 microcontroller. It is responsible for managing interrupts and handling them in a non-volatile manner.
The NVIC is divided into two main sections: the Global Interrupt Vector Table (GIVT) and the Global Interrupt Priority Register (GIPR).
The GIVT is a table of interrupt vectors that are mapped to specific interrupt sources. Each interrupt source can have multiple interrupt vectors assigned to it.
The GIPR is a register that controls the priority of interrupts. It allows the user to set the priority of each interrupt source, from lowest priority
